ticket.title: ActiveRecord "find" doesn't accept a :distinct parameter
ticket.original-body: When using AR's find method, there's no provision for passing a :distinct option. Let's say I have a table "Messages", with a column "author_id". I'd like to be able to perform the following query : SELECT DISTINCT author FROM messages; I think it would be pretty sweet to be able to do something along the lines of Message.find(:all, :distinct => :author) So basically, here are my question : - Would that be a good idea ? I guess not, otherwise I assume it would have been done already... - If it is, I'd be glad to contribute a patch. Any hints about the proper way to implement that ?

ticket.original-body-html:
When using AR's find method, there's no provision for passing a :distinct option.

Let's say I have a table "Messages", with a column "author_id". I'd like to be able to perform the following query :
SELECT DISTINCT author FROM messages;

I think it would be pretty sweet to be able to do something along the lines of
Message.find(:all, :distinct => :author)

So basically, here are my question :

  • Would that be a good idea ? I guess not, otherwise I assume it would have been done already...
  • If it is, I'd be glad to contribute a patch. Any hints about the proper way to implement that ?

version.body:
In the meantime you could use something like this:
@@@ ruby Message.group(:sponsors).all @@@
Although [is not the same](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/164319/is-there-any-difference-between-group-by-and-distinct)
